title: TFT Instrument Download Recovery Process

body.body: Ensure the latest version of the Triumph diagnostic tool software is installed.

The following procedure may be used to recover a TFT instrument download, in the event that a previous calibration download has failed and it is not possible to restart the download using the normal method.
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Before starting this procedure, ensure the battery voltage is at least 12.8 Volts.
An approved battery charger suitable for use with maintenance free batteries, may be used to maintain battery charge during this process.
Remove the rider’s seat as described in the Service Manual. Do not disconnect the battery.
Remove components as necessary to gain access to the instrument's electrical connector, as described in the Service Manual.
For keyless ignition models, make sure a paired key remains in range for the duration of this procedure.
Make sure the engine start/stop switch is in the STOP position.
Adjust the position of the instrument panel on its hinge to allow easier access the electrical connector.
Disconnect the electrical connector from the instruments.
Connect the Triumph diagnostic tool as described in the Service Manual.
Navigate to DOWNLOAD and select INSTRUMENT DOWNLOAD.
The current password for all calibration downloads can be found on TriumphOnline.
Enter the password then select Manual Model Selection.
Select the correct model and instrument calibration from the list, then click Next. The Download Confirmation screen is displayed.
Upon clicking Confirm, the Download Progress bar will appear. After a short delay, the diagnostic tool will start a download recovery period.
The status light at the bottom left of the screen will turn blue to indicate that the download recovery period is active. The message 'Recovery period active' will also be displayed.
The download recovery period is active for 30 seconds.
For successful recovery, the electrical connector must be reconnected to the instruments during this 30 second recovery period.

When reconnecting the instruments, it is important that all connector pins make electrical contact at the same time. To achieve this, make sure the electrical connector is aligned square to the housing before inserting it fully home with a quick, positive action.
A poor connection attempt may cause some connector pins to make electrical contact earlier than others. This can cause download recovery to fail.
Make sure the model and calibration details are correct in the Download Confirmation screen, then click Confirm.
Wait for the download recovery period to become active as described above.

body.name: TFT download recovery - recovery period active

body.body: Within 30 seconds of the recovery period becoming active, reconnect the electrical connector to the instruments and observe the instrument display.

If the recovery attempt has been successful, the red immobiliser LED will start flashing within five seconds of reconnecting the instruments. Do not disconnect the instrument electrical connector or turn the ignition OFF. Allow the calibration download to finish as normal.
If the red LED does not flash within five seconds of reconnecting, or a 'SCIOPTA Error' message is displayed, the recovery attempt has failed.

If a recovery attempt fails, further attempts may be made by disconnecting and reconnecting the instruments while the 30 second recovery period is active. It may take several attempts of reconnecting the instruments before a successful recovery is achieved.
If successful recovery is not achieved within the 30 second recovery period, turn the ignition OFF and restart the diagnostic software. Start the process again from step 3 to make further attempts.
Upon successful recovery, allow the download to complete as normal.
Click Finish when the download has completed, and erase any stored DTCs.
Disconnect the Triumph diagnostic tool and turn the ignition OFF.
Refit any components removed to gain access to the instrument electrical connector, as described in the Service Manual.
Refit the rider’s seat as described in the Service Manual.
In the event that recovery has been unsuccessful after numerous repeated attempts, contact Triumph service with a detailed description of each recovery attempt.

Please include the motorcycle model and VIN, the calibration number you were attempting to download, any observations of the behaviour of the TFT instrument display during each recovery attempt, screen shots of any failed download messages on the diagnostic tool and details of the computer/laptop used to run the diagnostic software.
